ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Notes: 1= Not at all worried; 2= A little worried; 3= Moderately worried; 4= Very worried

ElementDescription: Consider another weather event like Hurricane Idalia or an extreme heat wave happening in the next 5 years. How much do you worry about your home or belongings being seriously damaged or destroyed?
Notes: 1= Not at all worried; 2= A little worried; 3= Moderately worried; 4= Very worried

ElementDescription: Consider another weather event like Hurricane Idalia or an extreme heat wave happening in the next 5 years. How much do you worry about having added financial difficulties?
Notes: 1= Not at all worried; 2= A little worried; 3= Moderately worried; 4= Very worried

ElementDescription: At any time during or after major weather events that happened during 2023, were you unsure about the safety or whereabouts of any family members or close friends?
